PALISADE.presentation: ESC 2024 Investor Webinar - PALISADE Phase 3 Results

figures.title: Primary Endpoint: TG and APOC3 Reduction at Month 10
figures.description: Bar chart showing median percent change from baseline in triglycerides and APOC3 protein levels at Month 10 (primary) and Month 10/12 average
analysis: 80% TG reduction significantly exceeds standard of care fibrates (30-50% reduction)
Consistent robust effect across both 25mg and 50mg dose groups with similar efficacy
Near-complete APOC3 knockdown (-93% to -96%) validates RNAi mechanism of action
Highly significant p-values (<0.0001) demonstrate statistical robustness despite small sample size
figures.competitive_context: TG reduction superior to Ionis volanesorsen (~77%) and olezarsen (~60%). APOC3 knockdown comparable to ASO approaches but with better dosing convenience.

figures.title: Durability of Response: TG and APOC3 Reduction Over 12 Months
figures.description: Time course line charts showing sustained triglyceride and APOC3 reductions from baseline over 12 months of quarterly dosing

extracted_data.primary_endpoint: TG and APOC3 change over time

analysis: Rapid onset of action with ~70% TG reduction by Month 1 after first dose
Durable effect maintained through Month 12 with quarterly dosing (Q3M)
Sustained APOC3 knockdown throughout treatment period validates mechanism durability
Time course supports convenient quarterly dosing interval for chronic treatment
limitations: Variability increases in later timepoints (wider error bars)
figures.competitive_context: Quarterly dosing superior to volanesorsen (weekly) and potentially olezarsen (monthly). Sustained effect differentiates from fibrates requiring daily dosing.

figures.title: Individual Patient TG Response and Clinically Meaningful Thresholds
figures.description: Waterfall plot showing percent change in TG at Month 10 for each patient, with responder analysis table showing proportion achieving clinical thresholds

extracted_data.all_treated_responded: Nearly all plozasiran patients achieved >50% reduction

analysis: Consistent individual responses - nearly all plozasiran patients achieved meaningful TG reductions
75% of 25mg patients achieved TG <880 mg/dL threshold associated with reduced pancreatitis risk
Clear separation between treatment and placebo groups across all thresholds
Individual patient data demonstrates mechanism reliability and low non-responder rate
limitations: Threshold definitions vary in clinical significance
figures.competitive_context: Responder rates comparable to or better than volanesorsen Phase 3 data. Consistent individual responses suggest predictable clinical benefit.

figures.title: Reduction in Acute Pancreatitis Events
figures.description: Kaplan-Meier curve showing time to first acute pancreatitis event over 52 weeks, demonstrating 83% reduction in pancreatitis risk

extracted_data.primary_endpoint: Time to first acute pancreatitis event

analysis: 83% relative risk reduction in acute pancreatitis - the most feared complication of FCS
Statistically significant (p=0.029) despite small event numbers due to magnitude of effect
Clinical outcome endpoint strengthens regulatory and commercial positioning
Pancreatitis reduction directly addresses primary unmet need in FCS patient population
limitations: Low absolute event numbers (7 total events)
Wide confidence interval due to small sample
figures.competitive_context: First APOC3-targeting therapy to demonstrate pancreatitis reduction in randomized trial. Volanesorsen showed similar trends but with safety concerns.

figures.title: Summary of Adverse Events
figures.description: Safety summary table showing treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) across placebo and plozasiran groups
analysis: Favorable safety profile with lower serious TEAEs in plozasiran vs placebo (likely due to pancreatitis reduction)
No platelet reductions - key differentiator vs volanesorsen which has boxed warning for thrombocytopenia
Fewer premature discontinuations with plozasiran (8-12%) vs placebo (24%)
No deaths in any treatment group; no hepatotoxicity signals observed
limitations: Small sample size limits detection of rare events
figures.competitive_context: Clean safety profile differentiates from volanesorsen (thrombocytopenia boxed warning, platelet monitoring required). Supports broader use in clinical practice.
